answers.answer: I had lost a lot of weight for my wedding last Aug but wasn't to my goal weight yet. So, I'm still a bigger girl (size 16 usually). Keep focusing on eating right. Your big test will be when it's time to check for gestational diabetes. If you can, make sure to take walks daily. If you get gestational diabetes, it's a really strict diet. I think I have heard of some women also having to take insulin. Also watch your blood pressure. The blood pressure could be a sign of preclampsia.  Larger women have healthy babies all the time. These diagnosis aren't just for the big girls, but skinny ones too. The main focus for a pregnancy from what I can figure out (I'm 39 weeks tomorrow) is healthy mom and healthy baby. Keeping those as the focus helps. Keep your lines of communication open with your doc. I was so sick for the beginning of my pregnancy I actually lost about 37 lbs. I am a couple pounds now under my prepregnancy weight. Doc wasn't worried because I kept those communication lines open and we talked about everything. Good luck!!! and Congrats! :)
Thanks, i spoke to my dr early on about gestational diabetes and she said it wasnt something i should be worried about so that gave me SOME piece of mind.

Im a plus size expecting mom & this is my first baby as well. I'm 25wks 3days & I did end up getting gestational diabetes as well as being	 informed that my cervix is shorten & has dilated 1 cm. I think you'll be fine. Aside from the extra pounds you'll put on, everything should go by smoothly. I wish u the best & hope your pregnancy is a stress free one. Congrats & good luck.
I was a size 22, I'm 27 weeks. My doctor says to walk daily and eat healthy. She keeps a close eye on my BP, but so far baby and I are doing great :) Congrats and don't worry too much.

Im a big girl and i dont care. I make this look good! Im healthy as hell and maintain the weight i am. Im 20 weeks and only gained 5 lbs so far. No health issues except the normal pregnancy headaches and auxh but beaidea that im good. We can be bigger and have healthy pregnanciea if we try
Thank you for the positivity girls!
Me me size 16 well 18 now lol 25 weeks

I'm a size 18 and I'm 11weeks 3days. So far so good. I've been trying so hard to eat healthy but sometimes I just NEED chocolate!! Lol I go for my ultrasound tomorrow so I'm hoping to hear everything is going according to plan.

I'm 25 and 37 weeks pregnant with my 4th baby. I started my pregnancy weighing 290 and size 22. During the first 12 weeks I lost 8 pounds and at doctor today I was 292. I was tested 2 times for gestational diabetes and passed both. I've had no blood pressure or any health problems this pregnancy. I have not ate all that healthy either but I'm sure chasing a 18 months old helps.

question: Im a 1st time mom, size 24 & am 15 weeks pregnant. Thankfully, so far baby is doing Great & I haven't experienced morning sickness. Dr says my health stats are good (considering my weight) but what i want to know is, are there things plus size moms should look out for while pregnant? Something I should be asking my Dr? Any info or personal stories will be a help. :)
title: any plus-size pregnant girls?
